sen.j: 川西 清兵衛（かわにし せいべえ、慶応元年7月18日 (旧暦)（1865年9月7日） - 昭和22年（1947年）11月19日）は、日本の実業家。
sen.e: Seibe KAWANISHI (7 September, 1865 – 19 November, 1947) was a Japanese industrialist.
Seibe KAWANISHI (September 7, 1865 – November 19, 1947) was a Japanese industrialist.
Seibe KAWANISHI (September 7, 1865 – November 19, 1947) was a Japanese industrialist.
He was the founder of the Kawanishi combine.
He was the founder of the Kawanishi combine.
He was the founder of the Kawanishi combine.
Personal Profile
Personal Profile
Personal Profile

sen.j: 慶応元年（1865年）大坂で生まれる。
sen.e: In 1865, he was born in Osaka.
In 1865, he was born in Osaka.
In 1865, he was born in Osaka.

sen.j: 明治29年（1896年）神戸市の実業家27人を発起人として日本毛織を創立。
sen.e: In 1896, he established the Japan Wool Textile along with other 27 industrialists from Kobe city.
In 1896, he established the Japan Wool Textile along with 27 other industrialists from Kobe city.
In 1896, he established the Japan Wool Textile along with 27 other industrialists from Kobe city.

sen.j: 明治32年（1899年）加古川沿岸に工場を建設して毛布製造をはじめる。
sen.e: In 1899, he built a factory along the coast of Kako River and began manufacturing blankets.
In 1899, he built a factory along the coast of Kako River and began manufacturing blankets.
In 1899, he built a factory along the coast of Kako River and began manufacturing blankets.

sen.j: 戦時景気で軍用毛布等の売上が伸び巨利を得た。
sen.e: He gained an enormous profilt due to war economy by selling blankets to the military.
He gained an enormous profit due to war economy by selling blankets to the military.
He gained an enormous profit due to war economy by selling blankets to the military.

sen.j: 明治40年（1907年）兵庫電気軌道（山陽電気鉄道の前身）を創業し、神戸と明石、姫路を結ぶ電気鉄道を開業。
sen.e: In 1907, Hyogo Electric Railway (later known as Sanyo Electric Railway) was established by him and opened up the electric railroad to connect from Kobe to Akashi and to Himeji.
In 1907, Hyogo Electric Railway (later known as Sanyo Electric Railway) was established by him and opened up the electric railroad to connecting Kobe, Akashi and Himeji.
In 1907, Hyogo Electric Railway (later known as Sanyo Electric Railway) was established by him and opened up the electric railroad to connecting Kobe, Akashi and Himeji.

sen.j: 大正2年（1913年）日本毛糸紡績会社を設立、大正7年（1918年）日本毛織と合併。
sen.e: In 1913, he founded the Japan Worsted Spinning, and it was merged with the Japan Wool Textile in 1918.
In 1913, he founded the Japan Worsted Spinning, and it was merged with the Japan Wool Textile in 1918.
In 1913, he founded the Japan Worsted Spinning, and it was merged with the Japan Wool Textile in 1918.

sen.j: 昭和毛糸紡績、共立モスリン、山陽皮革、神戸生糸など多数の関連企業を設立し、川西財閥を形成する。
sen.e: He established various related companies such as the Showa Worsted Spinning, the Kyoritsu Muslin, the Sanyo Leather and the Kobe municipal Raw Silk which led to the formation of the Kawanishi combine.

He established various related companies such as the Showa Worsted Spinning, the Kyoritsu Muslin, the Sanyo Leather, and the Kobe municipal Raw Silk which led to the formation of the Kawanishi combine.

He established various related companies such as the Showa Worsted Spinning, the Kyoritsu Muslin, the Sanyo Leather, and the Kobe municipal Raw Silk which led to the formation of the Kawanishi combine.

sen.j: また、昭和6年（1931年）中島知久平と航空機製造を開始し、昭和9年（1934年）川西機械製作所を創業。
sen.e: In 1931, he began manufacturing airplanes with Chikuhei NAKAJIMA and established the Kawanishi Machinery Manufacture in 1934.
In 1931, he began manufacturing airplanes with Chikuhei NAKAJIMA and established the Kawanishi Machinery Manufacture in 1934.
In 1931, he began manufacturing airplanes with Chikuhei NAKAJIMA and established the Kawanishi Machinery Manufacture in 1934.

sen.j: 後に飛行機部を川西航空機として設立した。
sen.e: The airplane department was later reestablished as the Kawanishi Aircraft Company.
The airplane department was later reestablished as the Kawanishi Aircraft Company.
The airplane department was later reestablished as the Kawanishi Aircraft Company.

sen.j: 日本羊毛工業会会長、神戸商工会議所会頭をつとめた。
sen.e: He worked as the chairman for the Japan Wool Industry and the Kobe Chamber of Commerce and Industry.
He worked as the chairman for the Japan Wool Industry and the Kobe Chamber of Commerce and Industry.
He worked as the chairman for the Japan Wool Industry and the Kobe Chamber of Commerce and Industry.
